subject: Technology
title: T9: Texting on Number Keys
description: A micro-lesson that makes T9: Texting on Number Keys usable.

hook.text: Before touchscreens, you typed text messages by pressing the number 7 four times just to type the letter S.

buildup.text: T9 predictive text was a breakthrough. Press each key once and the phone guessed the word.

discovery.text: Teenagers mastered T9 so well they could text in their pockets without looking at the screen.

twist.text: T9 had hilarious failures. It often autocorrected to the wrong word, creating confusing messages.

climax.text: Autocorrect problems didn't end with T9. Smartphones inherited the exact same struggle.

punchline.text: Autocorrect has been ruining messages since before smartphones existed.
